name: q17_3
probTex:
Let $f$ be an analytic function on the unit disc. Suppose that $\operatorname{Re}(f(z))
eq0$ whenever $z
eq0$. Prove that $\operatorname{Re}(f(0))
eq0$.
solnTex:
The claim is trivial if $f$ is constant so assume $f$ is not constant. Then $f$ is an open map by the open mapping theorem. Let $r>0$ be small enough that $B_r(f(0))\subseteq f(\mathbb{D})$. Then $f(0)+i rac{r}{2}\in f(\mathbb{D})$. That is, there is some $w\in\mathbb{D}$ with $f(w)=f(0)+i rac{r}{2}$, or $\operatorname{Re}(f(w))=\operatorname{Re}(f(0))$. It can't be that $w=0$ because $f(w)
eq f(0)$, so by assumption $\operatorname{Re}(f(w))
eq0$. Therefore $\operatorname{Re}(f(0))
eq0$ as well.
